document.title: SP341-B-Sorghum Webworm in Grain Sorghum

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: The sorghum webworm (Figure 1) is an occasional pest of sorghum in Tennessee. Grain sorghum that is planted in late June can become severely damaged by this insect. Heavy infestations of webworms may completely destroy a developing grain head.
document.publication-title: Insects, Pests, Plant Diseases and Weeds
